evidence.title: {{pillar}} Research
evidence.description: Scientific evidence supporting {{pillar}} recommendations for longevity and healthspan.

default.impact: Your {{pillarName}} score indicates this area is impacting your biological aging trajectory.

recommendations.0: Focus on foundational health habits in this domain
recommendations.1: Consider working with specialist for personalized guidance
recommendations.2: Track metrics to monitor progress and adjust approach

default.quickWin: Identify one small improvement you can make this week

excellent.impact: Your sleep quality is actively slowing biological aging by optimizing cellular repair, hormone regulation, and metabolic health.

recommendations.0: Maintain consistent sleep-wake schedule to preserve circadian rhythm strength
recommendations.1: Continue optimizing sleep environment (darkness, temperature, quiet)
recommendations.2: Track HRV during sleep to monitor recovery quality

excellent.quickWin: Add 10-minute pre-bed wind-down routine with reading or meditation

good.impact: Your sleep provides solid foundation for health, but optimization could add 2-3 years to your healthspan.

recommendations.0: Establish consistent wake time (even weekends) to strengthen circadian rhythm
recommendations.1: Create 30-minute technology-free buffer before bed
recommendations.2: Experiment with room temperature between 65-68°F for deeper sleep

good.quickWin: Block blue light 2 hours before bed with amber glasses or night mode

fair.impact: Suboptimal sleep is accelerating aging by 3-5 years through chronic inflammation, impaired detoxification, and metabolic dysfunction.

recommendations.0: Set strict sleep schedule: same bedtime and wake time daily
recommendations.1: Address sleep hygiene: dark room, cool temperature, minimal noise
recommendations.2: Consider magnesium glycinate (300-400mg) 1 hour before bed
recommendations.3: Evaluate for sleep apnea if experiencing daytime fatigue

fair.quickWin: Establish 10pm bedtime target and track sleep duration for 1 week

poor.impact: Critical issue: Poor sleep quality is aging you 5-10 years faster by disrupting nearly every biological system.

recommendations.0: PRIORITY: Schedule sleep study to rule out sleep apnea or disorders
recommendations.1: Implement strict sleep hygiene protocol immediately
recommendations.2: Consider CBT-I (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia)
recommendations.3: Eliminate caffeine after 12pm and alcohol within 3 hours of bed
recommendations.4: Explore targeted supplements: magnesium, L-theanine, glycine

poor.quickWin: Start 7-day sleep reset: same bedtime/wake time, no screens 1 hour before bed

excellent.impact: Your stress management is protecting against cellular aging, maintaining healthy cortisol patterns, and preserving telomere length.

recommendations.0: Continue daily stress-reduction practices to maintain resilience
recommendations.1: Deepen mindfulness or meditation practice for greater impact
recommendations.2: Build social support networks as protective buffer

excellent.quickWin: Add 5-minute gratitude journaling to amplify positive mindset

good.impact: Your stress levels are manageable but periods of high stress may be contributing to accelerated aging.

recommendations.0: Establish daily 10-minute stress-reduction practice (meditation, breathing)
recommendations.1: Build stress resilience through regular exercise and nature exposure
recommendations.2: Consider adaptogenic herbs: rhodiola, ashwagandha for HPA axis support

good.quickWin: Practice 4-7-8 breathing (4sec in, 7sec hold, 8sec out) twice daily

fair.impact: Chronic stress is accelerating biological aging by 4-7 years through cortisol dysregulation, inflammation, and telomere shortening.

recommendations.0: Implement daily stress management: 20 minutes meditation or yoga
recommendations.1: Address root causes: work stress, relationships, financial concerns
recommendations.2: Consider professional support: therapy, counseling, or coaching
recommendations.3: Optimize magnesium intake and consider adaptogenic supplements

fair.quickWin: Start 5-minute morning meditation using guided app (Headspace, Calm)

poor.impact: URGENT: Severe stress is adding 8-12 years to your biological age and significantly increasing disease risk.

recommendations.0: PRIORITY: Seek professional mental health support immediately
recommendations.1: Implement daily stress-reduction protocol: 30min+ of proven techniques
recommendations.2: Consider intensive interventions: therapy, stress-reduction programs
recommendations.3: Address lifestyle factors: reduce commitments, improve boundaries
recommendations.4: Medical evaluation for anxiety/depression treatment if needed

poor.quickWin: Schedule appointment with therapist or counselor this week

excellent.impact: Your activity level is preserving muscle mass, mitochondrial function, and metabolic health—slowing aging by 5-10 years.

recommendations.0: Maintain diverse movement: strength, cardio, flexibility, balance
recommendations.1: Progress training intensity gradually to continue adaptations
recommendations.2: Prioritize recovery: sleep, nutrition, rest days

excellent.quickWin: Add 1 weekly session of zone 2 cardio (nasal breathing pace) for longevity

good.impact: Your activity provides good foundation, but increased consistency or intensity could add 3-5 years to healthspan.

recommendations.0: Increase strength training to 2-3x/week for muscle preservation
recommendations.1: Add high-intensity interval training 1-2x/week for metabolic benefit
recommendations.2: Ensure 8000+ daily steps for baseline movement throughout day

good.quickWin: Add 10-minute morning mobility routine before breakfast

fair.impact: Insufficient activity is accelerating aging by 4-6 years through muscle loss, metabolic decline, and reduced mitochondrial capacity.

recommendations.0: Build to 150 minutes moderate activity weekly (start with 20min daily walks)
recommendations.1: Add resistance training 2x/week (bodyweight or weights)
recommendations.2: Increase daily movement: standing desk, walking meetings, stairs
recommendations.3: Consider accountability: trainer, class, or workout partner

fair.quickWin: Commit to 15-minute daily walk after lunch or dinner

poor.impact: CRITICAL: Sedentary lifestyle is aging you 8-15 years faster and dramatically increasing disease risk.

recommendations.0: PRIORITY: Start with achievable goal: 10-minute daily walk
recommendations.1: Build gradually: add 5 minutes every week until reaching 30min
recommendations.2: Address barriers: schedule time, find enjoyable activities
recommendations.3: Consider medical clearance if over 40 or health concerns
recommendations.4: Hire trainer or join beginner class for structure and support

poor.quickWin: Take 5-minute walk after every meal starting today

excellent.impact: Your nutrition is optimizing cellular function, reducing inflammation, and supporting longevity pathways—potentially adding 10-15 years to healthspan.

recommendations.0: Continue emphasizing whole foods, plants, healthy fats, quality protein
recommendations.1: Optimize meal timing: consider 12-16 hour overnight fast
recommendations.2: Fine-tune macro ratios based on biomarkers and personal response

excellent.quickWin: Add 1 serving colorful vegetables to each meal for polyphenol diversity

good.impact: Your nutrition is supporting health, but refinements could reduce biological age by 3-5 years.

recommendations.0: Increase vegetable intake to 5-7 servings daily for fiber and phytonutrients
recommendations.1: Reduce processed foods and added sugars to minimize inflammation
recommendations.2: Optimize protein: 1.2-1.6g per kg bodyweight for muscle preservation
recommendations.3: Consider circadian-aligned eating: larger meals earlier in day

good.quickWin: Replace one processed snack daily with nuts, fruit, or vegetables

fair.impact: Suboptimal nutrition is accelerating aging by 5-8 years through inflammation, oxidative stress, and metabolic dysfunction.

recommendations.0: Eliminate ultra-processed foods and focus on whole food sources
recommendations.1: Increase plant diversity: 30+ different plant foods weekly
recommendations.2: Balance macros: protein at every meal, healthy fats, complex carbs
recommendations.3: Consider elimination trial to identify inflammatory foods
recommendations.4: Work with nutritionist for personalized guidance

fair.quickWin: Start every day with protein-rich breakfast within 1 hour of waking

poor.impact: URGENT: Poor nutrition is aging you 10-15 years faster and setting foundation for chronic disease.

recommendations.0: PRIORITY: Eliminate processed foods, sugary drinks, refined carbs
recommendations.1: Build foundation: whole foods, vegetables, quality protein, healthy fats
recommendations.2: Meal prep on weekends to ensure healthy options available
recommendations.3: Address emotional eating or disordered patterns with support
recommendations.4: Consider working with registered dietitian for personalized plan

poor.quickWin: Clear kitchen of processed foods and restock with whole food staples

excellent.impact: Your strong social connections are reducing mortality risk by 50% and protecting cognitive function as you age.

recommendations.0: Continue nurturing meaningful relationships and community involvement
recommendations.1: Deepen existing connections through quality time and vulnerability
recommendations.2: Mentor or volunteer to expand sense of purpose and contribution

excellent.quickWin: Schedule weekly connection ritual with close friend or family member

good.impact: Your social connections provide health benefits, but deepening relationships could add 2-3 years to lifespan.

recommendations.0: Prioritize quality over quantity: deepen 2-3 core relationships
recommendations.1: Join community activity aligned with interests (club, class, volunteer)
recommendations.2: Schedule regular social activities to maintain consistency
recommendations.3: Practice active listening and emotional vulnerability to strengthen bonds

good.quickWin: Reach out to one person you value but have not connected with recently

fair.impact: Limited social connection is accelerating aging by 3-5 years—equivalent health impact to smoking 15 cigarettes daily.

recommendations.0: Join structured social activity: class, group, club, volunteer role
recommendations.1: Reconnect with old friends or family members you have drifted from
recommendations.2: Consider therapy to address social anxiety or relationship patterns
recommendations.3: Build routine social touchpoints: coffee dates, phone calls, activities

fair.quickWin: Sign up for one social activity or class starting this month

poor.impact: CRITICAL: Social isolation is aging you 6-10 years faster and dramatically increasing mortality risk.

recommendations.0: PRIORITY: Address social isolation with professional support if needed
recommendations.1: Start small: one social interaction weekly (call, coffee, class)
recommendations.2: Join supportive community: support group, religious community, club
recommendations.3: Consider pet companionship as bridge to social connection
recommendations.4: Address underlying issues: anxiety, depression, past trauma with therapy

poor.quickWin: Call one friend or family member today for 10-minute check-in

excellent.impact: Your cognitive engagement is building robust cognitive reserve, reducing dementia risk by 40%, and maintaining neuroplasticity.

recommendations.0: Continue challenging brain with novel activities and learning
recommendations.1: Add meditation or mindfulness to enhance focus and brain structure
recommendations.2: Ensure adequate aerobic exercise for cerebral blood flow

excellent.quickWin: Add 10 minutes daily of brain training or learning new skill

good.impact: Your cognitive activities provide protection, but increased challenge could further reduce dementia risk.

recommendations.0: Learn new complex skill: instrument, language, dance, craft
recommendations.1: Increase reading diversity: non-fiction, complex subjects, varied topics
recommendations.2: Add daily brain training: puzzles, strategy games, memory exercises
recommendations.3: Combine physical and cognitive: dancing, martial arts, coordination activities

good.quickWin: Download language learning app and practice 15 minutes daily

fair.impact: Limited cognitive engagement is increasing dementia risk and allowing age-related cognitive decline.

recommendations.0: Engage in daily cognitively stimulating activities: reading, puzzles, learning
recommendations.1: Take up challenging new hobby requiring sustained focus and skill
recommendations.2: Increase social-cognitive activities: discussions, debates, teaching
recommendations.3: Address brain health foundations: sleep, exercise, nutrition, stress

fair.quickWin: Commit to 30 minutes daily reading of challenging material

poor.impact: URGENT: Low cognitive engagement significantly increases dementia risk and accelerates brain aging.

recommendations.0: PRIORITY: Implement daily cognitive stimulation program immediately
recommendations.1: Learn complex new skill requiring sustained effort and practice
recommendations.2: Join cognitive activities with social component: book club, classes
recommendations.3: Screen for and address cognitive decline with medical evaluation
recommendations.4: Optimize brain health: sleep, exercise, Mediterranean diet, stress management

poor.quickWin: Start daily crossword puzzle or sudoku with morning coffee
